docs.snippet: An increase of $6,644,000 in cash holdings was reported by the Clearing House institutions yesterday. Loans declined during the week by over $7,300,000 while deposits increased by about $6,000,000. The effect of these changes upon the surplus reserve...
docs.lead_paragraph: An increase of $6,644,000 in cash holdings was reported by the Clearing House institutions yesterday. Loans declined during the week by over $7,300,000 while deposits increased by about $6,000,000. The effect of these changes upon the surplus reserve was an increase of $5,839,800 which brings that item up to $23,016,300.

headline.main: BANKS GAIN CASH; ADD TO SURPLUS; Deposits Increased by About $6,000,000 and Loans Reduced $7,300,000.

docs.snippet: Speakers at the Saturday luncheon of the Republican Club, at 54 West Fortieth Street, discussed yesterday afternoon the best way of bringing Latin America and the United States into closer relations. Robert Bacon, formerly Ambassador to France, who...
docs.lead_paragraph: Speakers at the Saturday luncheon of the Republican Club, at 54 West Fortieth Street, discussed yesterday afternoon the best way of bringing Latin America and the United States into closer relations. Robert Bacon, formerly Ambassador to France, who visited South America as a representative of the Carnegie Peace Foundation recently, told what definite steps the Foundation was prepared to take.
docs.abstract: speaks at Republican Club luncheon on relations of the U. S. to Latin America

headline.main: PLAN CLOSER BONDS WITH LATIN AMERICA; Bacon Tells Republican Club of Carnegie Foundation's Work to Promote Better Feeling.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 29. -- Some remarkable facts are disclosed by a close study of the imports under the new Underwood tariff law, so far as they have been compiled by the Department of Commerce. The new customs act will pass its first half year of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 29. -- Some remarkable facts are disclosed by a close study of the imports under the new Underwood tariff law, so far as they have been compiled by the Department of Commerce. The new customs act will pass its first half year of operation next Saturday, April 4.
docs.abstract: report on imports for four months under new tariff law

docs.snippet: Edward Arlington, a partner in the firm of Miller Brothers of Oklahoma, which owns the "101 Ranch Wild West Show," which is to follow the circus at Madison Square Garden, arrived yeserday on the Lamport  Holt liner Vasari from South America. He said...
docs.lead_paragraph: Edward Arlington, a partner in the firm of Miller Brothers of Oklahoma, which owns the "101 Ranch Wild West Show," which is to follow the circus at Madison Square Garden, arrived yeserday on the Lamport Holt liner Vasari from South America. He said the show was at Trinidad in the West Indies.
docs.abstract: tells of shooting of 48 trained horses belonging to Wild West Show by Argentine officials

headline.main: SHOT 48 TRAINED HORSES.; Argentine Officials Thought "Wild West" Animals Had Glanders.
PRINCE HENRY IN URUGUAY.; He Is Entertained at Dinner by President Battle y Ordonez.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 11. -- Secretary Bryan's expressed determination that there should be one department of the Government, to be run for less money under the Democratic Administration than before, was nullified by the House Committee on Foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 11. -- Secretary Bryan's expressed determination that there should be one department of the Government, to be run for less money under the Democratic Administration than before, was nullified by the House Committee on Foreign Affairs to-day. Secretary Bryan was able to effect a reduction of $120 in the estimates for the support of the State Department submitted for incorporation in the Legislative, Executive, and Judicial Appropriation bill.

headline.main: BRYAN'S ECONOMY COMES TO NAUGHT; House Committee Reports Diplomatic and Consular Bill Carrying Increase of $783,335.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 21. -- Uruguay's willingness to sign a peace treaty with the United States, along the lines of those already signed by Secretary Bryan with many other nations, was communicated to Mr. Bryan to-day by Dr. De Pena, Uruguayan Minister...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 21. -- Uruguay's willingness to sign a peace treaty with the United States, along the lines of those already signed by Secretary Bryan with many other nations, was communicated to Mr. Bryan to-day by Dr. De Pena, Uruguayan Minister in Washington.
docs.abstract: Uruguay expresses willingness to sign treaty
